job_tasks.phrase: enablers of the digital transformation for business
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly indicates the role's focus on enabling business transformation through technology.

job_tasks.phrase: align technical solutions with strategic goals
job_tasks.justification: This is a core aspect of business understanding, requiring the technical team to connect their work to business objectives.

job_tasks.phrase: accelerated and sustainable adoption of cloud across the enterprise (both business and IT) - maximizing the ability to realize its benefits while reducing risk
job_tasks.justification: This describes the strategic goal of the Cloud CoE, which the engineer supports by understanding business needs and benefits.

job_tasks.phrase: supporting business-initiatives in adapting cloud technologies (including organizational change)
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the need to understand and support business-driven initiatives.

job_tasks.phrase: Possess a good balance between technical proficiency, business understanding with communication skills
job_tasks.justification: Explicitly mentions business understanding as a required attribute.

job_tasks.phrase: Be evangelist of Cloud computing to the rest of NXP
job_tasks.justification: Evangelizing requires understanding the business value and communicating it effectively.

job_tasks.phrase: Pro-actively collaborate with other IT teams and business teams
job_tasks.justification: Collaboration with business teams implies understanding their needs and objectives.

job_tasks.phrase: Actively participate in communities / forums / guilds on cloud computing and data solutions
job_tasks.justification: Participation in these groups often involves understanding broader trends and business applications.

job_tasks.phrase: Design, implement and maintain a fully automated cloud platform and cloud products
job_tasks.justification: This involves the core software engineering task of building and maintaining platforms.

job_tasks.phrase: Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines, re-usable cloud data products, and underlying enabling tooling for Cloud based IT services, including documentation.
job_tasks.justification: This clearly describes software development tasks related to infrastructure and product creation.

job_tasks.phrase: Developing and maintaining ( incl lifecycle management) re-usable cloud products.
job_tasks.justification: Focuses on the development and ongoing management of software products.

job_tasks.phrase: operate a cloud platforms and cloud products
job_tasks.justification: Operating platforms and products falls under the umbrella of operations engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: Work in DevOps / Scrum settings and apply techniques of continuous verification & delivery to ensure the quality of our products and services.
job_tasks.justification: DevOps, continuous verification, and delivery are core MLOps/operations engineering practices.

job_tasks.phrase: You built it , you run it
job_tasks.justification: This phrase is a strong indicator of ownership and operational responsibility, a key aspect of MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: Respond to technical issues in a professional and timely manner
job_tasks.justification: Responding to issues is an operational responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: piloting emerging cloud technologies (e.g. GenAI, Machine Learning)
job_tasks.justification: While not directly building models, piloting emerging technologies like ML/GenAI implies an involvement in understanding and testing them, which touches upon modeling.
This lists areas of participation that include machine learning, indicating some level of engagement with modeling concepts.

soft_skills.phrase: a good balance between technical proficiency, business understanding with communication skills.
communication skills to effectively share your knowledge.
Stay up to speed with the newest Cloud technologies
Pro-actively collaborate with other IT teams and business teams
You built it , you run it

classification.rationale: This role heavily emphasizes cloud platform engineering, DevOps, and CI/CD, aligning with traditional infrastructure and software development rather than specialized AI roles. While GenAI and Machine Learning are mentioned as areas of piloting and participation, they are not the core focus or primary responsibilities of the job.
